app.title: Freak Show
app.subtitle: Visualization of topic and speaker development over the years

errors.noMp3Url: No MP3 URL found for this episode (episodes.json)

about.title: About this Project
about.subtitle: Technologies and tools behind the Freak Show River Visualization

freakshow.title: Freak Show
freakshow.description: This project is based on the podcast Freak Show. Learn more at

projectDescription.title: Project Description
projectDescription.content: This interactive AI application analyzes and visualizes the topics and speakers of the Freak Show Podcast over the years. Using AI-powered text analysis, semantic search, and clustering algorithms, topics are grouped and their temporal development is displayed in river diagrams. With speaker personas and discussion mode, questions can be answered in the style of the podcast hosts. The project was developed at 39C3.

frontend.title: Frontend Technologies
frontend.vue: Progressive JavaScript Framework for reactive user interface
frontend.typescript: Type-safe programming for more robust code
frontend.d3: Data visualization library for interactive river diagrams
frontend.tailwind: Utility-First CSS Framework for modern design
frontend.vite: Fast build tool and development server

backend.title: Backend & Data Processing
backend.rust: High-performance clustering algorithms for topic analysis
backend.rayon: Parallel processing in Rust for faster clustering
backend.serde: Serialization and deserialization of episode data

embedding.title: OpenAI text-embedding-3-large
embedding.description: Generation of semantic embeddings for all podcast topics. Enables meaning-based clustering instead of just keyword matching.

clustering.title: Hierarchical Clustering
clustering.description: Automatic grouping of similar topics based on cosine similarity of embeddings.

rag.title: RAG Search Backend
rag.description: Semantic search across transcripts with cited sources and jump-to-time playback. Uses OpenAI GPT-4o-mini for answer generation.

features.citations: Answers include sources (episode + time window + excerpt)
features.playback: One-click audio playback from cited timestamps
features.auth: Optional auth token for protected backends

cursor.title: Cursor
cursor.description: AI-powered development environment for faster and smarter code generation.

features.sonnet: Claude Sonnet 4.5 - Fast code generation and refactoring
features.opus: Claude Opus 4.5 - Complex problem solving and architecture decisions
features.gpt52: GPT-5.2 - Advanced code generation and reasoning

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.description: This project is open source and available on GitHub. Feel free to explore the code, contribute, or use it for your own podcast analysis projects.

extraction.title: Episode Data Extraction
extraction.description: Loading episode metadata and topics from JSON files

embedding.title: Embedding Generation
embedding.description: OpenAI API creates semantic vectors for each topic

clustering.title: Clustering Analysis
clustering.description: Rust-based hierarchical clustering groups similar topics

aggregation.title: Time Series Aggregation
aggregation.description: Node.js aggregates data by years for river visualization

visualization.title: Interactive Visualization
visualization.description: D3.js renders data as interactive stream graphs

variants.title: Variant Selector
variants.description: Switch between different clustering variants and compare results

search.title: AI Search
search.description: Ask questions and get answers with cited transcript sources

personas.title: Speaker Personas
personas.description: Answers in the style of different speakers with individual personalities

discussion.title: Discussion Mode
discussion.description: Two speakers discuss and debate a topic based on sources

markdown.title: Markdown Rendering
markdown.description: Formatted answers with headings, lists, code, and emphasis

umap.title: UMAP View
umap.description: 2D projection of topic embeddings for exploration

heatmaps.title: Heatmaps
heatmaps.description: Explore relationships like Speaker√óCluster and Cluster√óCluster

darkMode.title: Dark Mode
darkMode.description: Theme toggle with automatic and persistent settings

footer.copyright: ¬© 2025 ‚Ä¢ All data based on publicly available podcast information

interaction.hover: Hover over a cell to see details.
interaction.click: Click on a cell to display the episode list.

noVariants.title: No Clustering Variants Available
noVariants.subtitle: To use this view, you need to create a clustering variant first.

step1.title: Create a V1 variant (256 clusters)
step1.description: Hierarchical clustering with fixed cluster count (~20 seconds)

step2.title: Or a V2 variant (automatic)
step2.description: HDBSCAN with automatic cluster detection (~2 minutes)

step3.title: Reload page
step3.description: After successful generation, reload the page and select variant from dropdown.

note.title: Prerequisite
note.description: Topic embeddings must be created first (node scripts/create-embeddings.js).
